subject: Photography
title: Curves and S-Curves
description: A short lesson to help you apply Curves and S-Curves.

hook.text: A winding road through a valley. A river snaking through a forest. Curves are nature's leading lines.

buildup.text: S-curves create a graceful, flowing path through the image. The eye follows them naturally and slowly.

discovery.text: Unlike straight lines that rush the eye forward, curves invite the viewer to linger and explore the frame.

twist.text: The S-curve is a classical art principle borrowed from Renaissance painting. Photography inherited centuries of wisdom.

climax.text: Roads, rivers, coastlines, even the human body â€” S-curves appear everywhere once you learn to see them.

punchline.text: Straight lines get you there fast. Curves make the trip beautiful.

quiz.question: How do S-curves affect the viewer's experience?
options: They create a flowing path that invites the eye to linger
